result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul M Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul M Moore in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for senencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/07/16)

ADDRESS INFO for Paul M Moore
Current: 139 N. 4th Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 03-01-2016)
Prior: 324 Quincy St, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to write any checks or use a checking account.

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers will be representing defendant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State requests cash bond with conditions. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Paul M Moore appears by video conference along with attorney Brett E Reetz who appears by phone.  Defendant Paul M Moore in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant requests time to talk to PD to get counsel appointed. Atty Gerbers also present in court, indicates he has to go down to the jail later today, will talk to defendant. Court will recall case later this afternoon.
Bond warrant - in lieu of bringing defendant's body before the court, defendany may post $1,164 to arresting agency.
